result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Henry Geigel

records.addlTxt: FPT for 10/21/22 adjourned to 11/28/22 at 1:30 pm on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Notice sent.
Final pre-trial on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Clerk NN left voicemail for DE regarding FPT on 10/21/22 getting rescheduled due to the Court's unavailability.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Jennifer F- C.

01:36 PM    Assistant District Attorney Sydney Star appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Michelle Knapp.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES:   The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.. $500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event). rb
